description: Just Another Team's recommendations for Season 15. Recommended for Mouse and Keyboard.
name: Just Another Team's MnK rolls - Season 15

data.description: Headstone makes this sidearm excellent when combined with a proper character stasis build, offering easy crystals without ability usage to either break or stand next to depending on your build.
Headstone makes this sidearm excellent when combined with a proper character stasis build, offering easy crystals without ability usage to either break or stand next to depending on your build.
Headstone makes this sidearm excellent when combined with a proper character stasis build, offering easy crystals without ability usage to either break or stand next to depending on your build.
Headstone makes this sidearm excellent when combined with a proper character stasis build, offering easy crystals without ability usage to either break or stand next to depending on your build.
This weapon has the same “bugged” reticle as Gridskipper (it moves a whole lot as you strafe). It may bother you, it may not. But if the weapon feels off, that is why.
This weapon has the same “bugged” reticle as Gridskipper (it moves a whole lot as you strafe). It may bother you, it may not. But if the weapon feels off, that is why.

This weapon has the same “bugged” reticle as Gridskipper (it moves a whole lot as you strafe). It may bother you, it may not. But if the weapon feels off, that is why.
This weapon has the same “bugged” reticle as Gridskipper (it moves a whole lot as you strafe). It may bother you, it may not. But if the weapon feels off, that is why.

The best rocket in the game right now. Adaptive frames do the most damage of all rocket frames, and Hothead gets both Adept mods and the best perks in the game. FP + CC for a pairing with Gjally, or ALH + Explosive Light/Vorpal/Lasting for an excellent hotswap rocket
This is an aggressive frame shotgun that can have the highest Handling of any in the game on an Arc subclass with Elemental Capacitor and either Threat Detector or Surplus.
This is an aggressive frame shotgun that can have the highest Handling of any in the game on an Arc subclass with Elemental Capacitor and either Threat Detector or Surplus.
Only Rampage x3 will affect the ttk, but both other levels of rampage improve the optimal headshot ratio.
Only Rampage x3 will affect the ttk, but both other levels of rampage improve the optimal headshot ratio.
Judgement can only 2 tap with MKC x 3, but x1 and x2 both improve the usability (2c1b at x1, 1c2b at x2).
Judgement can only 2 tap with MKC x 3, but x1 and x2 both improve the usability (2c1b at x1, 1c2b at x2).

This pulse has the highest range in it’s archetype. With 22 base zoom and Killing Wind proc’d, it can reach up to 50m before it encounters damage falloff. Despite this amazing range the maps are not set up for such long range weapons, and combined with Legal Action’s mediocre perks it cannot beat Messenger for best in slot.

This pulse has the highest range in it’s archetype. With 22 base zoom and Killing Wind proc’d, it can reach up to 50m before it encounters damage falloff. Despite this amazing range the maps are not set up for such long range weapons, and combined with Legal Action’s mediocre perks it cannot beat Messenger for best in slot.
Under Pressure gives increased aim assist when on low ammo, essentially operating as a minor version of Opening Shot.
Under Pressure gives increased aim assist when on low ammo, essentially operating as a minor version of Opening Shot.
While this pulse is the only solar rapid fire in the game, overall it pales in comparison to Darkest Beyond for PvP.
While this pulse is the only solar rapid fire in the game, overall it pales in comparison to Darkest Beyond for PvP.

In PvP Eyasluna does not reach the same ranges that Adept Fate can, while still “wasting” a perk slot on Rangefinder. However this allows it to reach into more interesting builds while not focusing wholly on range. If you prefer the feel of Eyasluna then a Rangefinder + Moving Target roll is the play for the range, but Unrelenting is a surprisingly good 6s perk, while Demo can be used to better use your now slower charging grenades.

The God Combo of Quickdraw + Snapshot returns on a 90 rpm sniper. Personally I’d go all in on Handling with a Qd + Snap sniper, to help with the stow speed and attempt to match the old version of Quickdraw as closely as possible (potentially even using Quick Access Sling if you can justify the loss of the option of air shots. Despite the return of the old combo, don’t discount Firmly Planted as an excellent accuracy booster when crouching.

The God Combo of Quickdraw + Snapshot returns on a 90 rpm sniper. Personally I’d go all in on Handling with a Qd + Snap sniper, to help with the stow speed and attempt to match the old version of Quickdraw as closely as possible (potentially even using Quick Access Sling if you can justify the loss of the option of air shots. Despite the return of the old combo, don’t discount Firmly Planted as an excellent accuracy booster when crouching.
This sword doesn’t match Guillotine in pure damage, so speccing into Demo and Chain Reaction is better for a utility sword usage. PvP: You do not care for the roll if you are using a sword in PvP.
This sword doesn’t match Guillotine in pure damage, so speccing into Demo and Chain Reaction is better for a utility sword usage. PvP: You do not care for the roll if you are using a sword in PvP.

The God Combo of Quickdraw + Snapshot returns on a 90 rpm sniper. Personally I’d go all in on Handling with a Qd + Snap sniper, to help with the stow speed and attempt to match the old version of Quickdraw as closely as possible (potentially even using Quick Access Sling if you can justify the loss of the option of air shots. Despite the return of the old combo, don’t discount Firmly Planted as an excellent accuracy booster when crouching.
The return of an ALH Blinding grenade launcher for PvE. While Ignition Code is better for pure dps thanks to slideshot skipping the wait for a reload, ALH is better for pure blinding.
While Rangefinder would appear to be the instant choice, it puts the weapon closer to 22 zoom which is a lot on a pulse. User beware.
While Rangefinder would appear to be the instant choice, it puts the weapon closer to 22 zoom which is a lot on a pulse. User beware.
Any subsistence roll could double as a Prometheus-lite in at level content, but the usefulness of trace rifles has always fallen off quickly as soon as you get out of that level range.

Easier access to Eager Edge due to it being less rare, but cannot be paired with damage perks thanks to Eager rolling in the final column. Pick one up to tide you over with speed while you search for “The Other Half” with Eager Edge and a damage perk. PvP: It’s a sword in PvP, you don’t care about the roll.

Easier access to Eager Edge due to it being less rare, but cannot be paired with damage perks thanks to Eager rolling in the final column. Pick one up to tide you over with speed while you search for “The Other Half” with Eager Edge and a damage perk. PvP: It’s a sword in PvP, you don’t care about the roll.

Eager Edge + a damage perk, making it more useful than “Half Truths”, but you’re searching for Eager Edge anyway - so a good roll on this weapon is a nice to have. PvP: It’s a sword in PvP, you don’t care about the roll.

Under Pressure gives increased aim assist when on low ammo, essentially operating as a minor version of Opening Shot.

For PvE, the damage boost of Explosive Light and reload boost of Impulse Amplifier make Ascendancy a good pick, only beaten by rng near-perfect rolled Rockets. PvP uses the speed increase of Impulse Amplifier to give your opponents less time to react and Chain to add in a bit more delayed splash damage to potentially get another kill.

For PvE, the damage boost of Explosive Light and reload boost of Impulse Amplifier make Ascendancy a good pick, only beaten by rng near-perfect rolled Rockets. PvP uses the speed increase of Impulse Amplifier to give your opponents less time to react and Chain to add in a bit more delayed splash damage to potentially get another kill.

Grab a Cold Steel roll if that perk interests you, and Duelist’s Trance is a perk that can see some play in improving dps at the cost of not having the ammo economy of Relentless, especially when combo’d with Swordmasters Guard (assuming you get a kill before going at the boss). PvP: It’s a sword in PvP, you don’t care about the roll
